preprocessing_utils module

preprocessing_utils.load_tables(names, path_from)[source]

Reads tables from path_from address with names from the list names into the dictionary.

Parameters:

  • names – List[str]: table names

  • path_from – str: path to the tables

Returns:

Dict[str, pd.DataFrame]: dictionary, its keys are names list items, values are loaded tables from path_from/name.csv

preprocessing_utils.quantize_table(df, freq='300ms')[source]

Returns a dataframe quantized by freq-sized windows. Inside each window it calculates some statistics (mean, median, standard deviation, and others).

Parameters:

  • df – pd.DataFrame: unprocessed dataframe

  • freq – str: quantization window width

Returns:

pd.DataFrame: dataframe quantized by freq-sized windows

preprocessing_utils.save_tables(df_dict, names, path_to)[source]

Saves tables from df_dict dictionary with keys from names` list.

Parameters:

  • df_dict – Dict[str, pd.DataFrame]: dictionary with dataframes

  • names – List[str]: a subset of the df_dict keys for which the tables are to be saved

  • path_to – str: the address where we want to save the tables

preprocessing_utils.separate_and_save(df, names, sep_col='symbol', path_to_save='data/')[source]

Splits the table into several small tables according to the value of the sep_col column.

Parameters:

  • df – pd.DataFrame: a large table, which must be divided into several smaller ones

  • names – List[str]: the values of the sep_col column for which the tables are to be saved

  • sep_col – str: the name of the column by which we want to split the table

  • path_to_save – str: the address where we want to save the tables

Returns:

nothing is returned, separated tables by sep_col column values from the names list are saved to the address path_to_save in csv format

preprocessing_utils.triple_dot(c1: ndarray, c2: ndarray, c3: ndarray) → ndarray[source]

accelerated intermediate calculations in the table separating process
